ygData.subject: Re: What do you think of begging (not the skill)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... I wouldn t kill somoeone on sight who did that. But I believe in making things a challenge. Free banded gorget to the first one to find me. From where I
ygData.messageBody:
At 12:24 PM 09/09/99 -0400, you wrote:
>From: Chris Wheeler <wheelech@...>
>
>Hi all.
>
>I gave seen this debate before in other places.
>
>What do you all think of begging as a method of acquiring
>cash/armour/weapons?
>
>I don't mean the skill of begging, but I mean approaching other PC's and
>asking them to spare a bit?

I wouldn't kill somoeone on sight who did that. But I believe in making
things a challenge. "Free banded gorget to the first one to find me. From
where I am, I can see an undead pawn and a goblin shaman"

One of these days, I'm going to hold a scavenger hunt. Say, 20 items. Some
can only be found in one place in Norrath. The first one to get them all to
me. (or, barring that, the one who gets the MOST from the list) gets a
full set.

I've also been kicking around the idea of a marathon from Qeynos to Crushbone

I have nothing against giving stuff away, but make 'em work for it -;>

Lareneg. Cleric of The Tribunal
